meanings.definition: (adjective) requiring close attention to detail; intricate or finicky
meanings.sent1: The fiddly puzzle pieces needed careful handling.
meanings.sent2: She found the fiddly task of threading a needle challenging.
meanings.sent3: Trying to untangle the fiddly knots in the yarn was like solving a mini mystery.
meanings.sent4: The fiddly mechanism of the old clock reminded him of a delicate dance.
meanings.sent5: The fiddly design of the model ship made it a true test of patience.

meanings.definition: (adverb) in a finicky or intricate manner
meanings.sent1: She worked fiddly, ensuring each detail was perfect.
meanings.sent2: He adjusted the tiny screws fiddly, making sure they were secure.
meanings.sent3: The chef sprinkled the spices fiddly, like a magician casting a spell.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted fiddly, creating a masterpiece with precision.
meanings.sent5: The tailor sewed the delicate fabric fiddly, crafting a beautiful dress.
